title: Wallet -> Sending a transaction in certain locations may cause crashes because of blocked / limited requests by provider (Infura / POKT)
body: ### Description **UPD:** it seems that transactions performed in a location that could be blocked / banned by web3 provider (infura or pokt) are causing crashes, we need to add a guard for this **NOTE:** this is a recovery flow as follows: 1. open status with no previous data (clean install) 2. click I already use Status 3. click I dont have other device 4. click Enter a seed phrase 5. enter a seed for account (reach out to me if u want to test on the specific account i am using) 6. log in and do not enable biometric login (use password) 7. open wallet. **NOTE:** all previously added accounts are there (even watch only accounts) 8. click plus button 9. enter account name 10. click Edit and enter password. App crashes ``` signal 16 received but handler not on signal stack fatal error: non-Go code set up signal handler without SA_ONSTACK flag runtime stack: runtime.throw({0x1064183ca?, 0x14000102480?}) /usr/local/go/src/runtime/panic.go:1047 +0x40 fp=0x1400005a790 sp=0x1400005a760 pc=0x1062dd5c0 runtime.sigNotOnStack(0x10) /usr/local/go/src/runtime/signal_unix.go:1029 +0x5c fp=0x1400005a7b0 sp=0x1400005a790 pc=0x1062f38ec runtime.adjustSignalStack(0x10, 0x1400004c000, 0x1400005a858) /usr/local/go/src/runtime/signal_unix.go:581 +0x250 fp=0x1400005a820 sp=0x1400005a7b0 pc=0x1062f2c20 @alaibe @Khushboo-dev-cpp @dlipicar i finally figured it out (how to reproduce). Ping me if u need USDC, i have a lot
I feel like @alaibe recently fixed this, there was a function missing or something like that.
Yeah a dejavu!!! the stack trace however says something about keycard. @saledjenic could it be related?

SIGSEGV: Illegal storage access. (Attempt to read from nil?)
make: *** [Makefile:747: run-linux] Segmentation fault (core dumped)
I removed it from 0.12.0 because it is very edge case but it is still good to have it fixed (add guard)

> Yeah a dejavu!!! the stack trace however says something about keycard. @saledjenic could it be related?

Yes, it is related. We already have a few crash issues logged, but in general all of them refer to the same issue - keycard lib issue (one we thought was fixed by changing Go version).
closing this one in favor of https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10743
